Nipa virus is transmitted to humans
through contact with the fluids of swine bats
or other people infected with nipa virus
was first identified in 1999
since then  Outbreaks of this disease
have taken place in Bangladesh, India and
Singapore. In Bangladesh alone, more than
160 people have woken up to the country's health ministry
warning people not to eat fruit
that birds or bats have partly eaten and drank
tree sap.  Fresh dates currently have no
treatment or vaccine to prevent
this virus. According to the World Health Organization, the
mortality rate of people infected with
nipa virus is about 40 minutes to 75
